sentences.en: ADSL is always on, which makes your PC much more vulnerable to hacking.
sentences.cn: 一直挂在线上会使你的个人电脑更容易被黑客攻击。

sentences.en: But modern humans were more vulnerable to the cold .
sentences.cn: 但是现代人更容易受到寒冷的攻击。

sentences.en: Goodyear could be vulnerable in a prolonged economic slump.
sentences.cn: 经济长期疲软可能会对固特异公司造成影响。

sentences.en: He took advantage of me when I was at my most vulnerable.
sentences.cn: 他在我最脆弱的时候利用了我。

sentences.en: He volunteered to protect her as she looked so vulnerable.
sentences.cn: 她看上去很脆弱,他就主动去保护她.

sentences.en: I hesitated to apply the word "vulnerable" to him but it came into my mind.
sentences.cn: 我不愿用“脆弱”这个词来形容他，但它却突然出现在我脑子里了。

sentences.en: It can be very hard to think rationally when you're feeling so vulnerable and alone.
sentences.cn: 人在脆弱和孤独的时候很难理智地思考。

sentences.en: Lacking self-confidence and maturity, many teenagers are left feeling very vulnerable.
sentences.cn: 许多十几岁的孩子既缺乏自信又不够懂事，所以感情上十分脆弱。

sentences.en: Migrant workers are vulnerable to exploitation.
People with high blood pressure are especially vulnerable to diabetes.
sentences.cn: 有高血压的人尤其易患糖尿病。

sentences.en: Plants that are growing vigorously are less likely to be vulnerable to disease.
sentences.cn: 生命力强的植物不容易得病。

sentences.en: She was left feeling exposed and vulnerable.
sentences.cn: 她感到自己孤立无助，非常脆弱。

sentences.en: The company is in an economically vulnerable position.
sentences.cn: 该公司目前经济状况不稳定.

sentences.en: The refugees, without a doubt, are the most vulnerable.
sentences.cn: 难民无疑是最易受到伤害的。

sentences.en: Tourists can be vulnerable to scams and con schemes of all kinds.
sentences.cn: 游客们会很容易陷入各种形形色色的骗局。

sentences.en: We work mainly with the elderly and other vulnerable groups.
sentences.cn: 我们主要和老年人以及其他弱势群体打交道。

trans.tran_cn: （地方）易受攻击的，易受伤的，易受批评的，[桥牌]已成局的
trans.tran_en: someone who is vulnerable can be easily harmed or hurt
